commentary_text: Here we go! Who will be meeting Spain in Sunday's final? The second semi-final is under way.
The Netherlands win a free-kick inside the opening 20 seconds. A long ball forward and Donyell Malen is trying to reach it but he's offside.
Jude Bellingham is tussling for the ball with Xavi Simons in the centre circle. Tonight could be a good battle between the two 21-year-olds. It's a slow and steady start from both sides.
Nice move by England involving Jude Bellingham and Harry Kane before the ball is played out wide to Bukayo Saka who sends in a cross which is headed away.
Great work by Bukayo Saka to steal the ball off Cody Gakpo out wide on the halfway line but England cannot make it count.

That's a rocket! No wonder they are saying good things about Xavi Simons. He wins the ball off Declan Rice and from the edge of the box unleashes an unstoppable finish into the net. Jordan Pickford dives in an attempt to keep it out but he wasn't getting to that.
Time for cool heads. England been behind before at this tournament but they have serious work to do.
Bukayo Saka wins a free-kick inside the Dutch half after being shoved to the floor by Cody Gakpo. By the way, Saka has been one of England's better players so far.
That goal was timed at 6:41. The Netherlands have avoided defeat in their last four matches when scoring first in the European Championship, since a 2-1 loss to Portugal in 2012.
SO CLOSE! Good work by Bukayo Saka leads to an attempt by Harry Kane which flashes agonisingly over. Kane is hurt after connecting with Denzel Dumfries while getting his shot away.
Oh, hello! Have England won a penalty?
The referee has been told to go and a look at his monitor after Denzel Dumfries made contact with Harry Kane for that shot.
A roar goes up from England fans. Harry Kane has the ball in his hand.
As cool as you like! He's been criticised, he's been told he's not playing well enough...but Harry Kane has got England back on level terms. Great penalty.
Danny Murphy has just said that penalty wouldn't have been awarded in the Premier League. Who cares?
Harry Kane is now joint leading scorer at Euro 2024 with three goals. Drop him? You're having a laugh.
England have scored each of their 13 penalties since the 2022 World Cup.

The Netherlands are on the ropes! Phil Foden wiggles free inside the Netherlands box and looks to have done all the hard work but his final attempt does not fully cross the line and it is hacked clear.
THIS IS SO MUCH BETTER. England fans have waited a long time for this type of performance. England are going for it and they look dangerous with every attack.
Three attempts on target by England. They're a lot more livelier. They would be ahead too but for Denzel Dumfries' clearance off the line to deny Phil Foden.
Phil Foden is causing all sorts of problems. He thinks he is about to burst clean through but is fouled by Denzel Dumfries, who is already on a booking. The referee doesn't see it.
This is action-packed. You cannot take your eyes off it. Denzel Dumfries is everywhere! Now he clatters the bar with a powerful header.
This is a brilliant watch. Two goals, a clearance off the line, a header against the bar and a long-range attempt that comes back off the post.
What's this? A huge blow for the Netherlands as Memphis Depay is forced off with an injury. On comes Joey Veerman.
They're outnumbered but they're making all the noise. It's fair to say England's fans are encouraged by what they are seeing.
Where has this half gone? It's flown by. Two teams who are really going for it. Two teams who really want to play Spain in Sunday's final.
Cheeky by Kobbie Mainoo! A back-heel from the 19-year-old for Phil Foden who goes for goal. Bart Verbruggen makes the save. Where have England been hiding? They seriously look in the mood tonight.
Kobbie Mainoo is a joy to watch when he plays like this. A flick here, a flick there. The teenager is right at the heart of England's best moves.
Phil Foden is playing like an animal that has been freed into the wild after being caged for so long.

England are ending the half strongly. Kieran Trippier tries to find Phil Foden, who is lurking inside the six-yard area, with a cross. Bart Verbruggen plucks the ball from the air before it can drop to England's No 11.
Three additional minutes at the end of the first half.
I don't think England want this half to end. The reaction to falling behind has been excellent. Gareth Southgate will feel his side should really be leading.
England's best 45 minutes of Euro 2024. No doubt about it.
The second half starts with Luke Shaw on for Kieran Trippier. The Dutch have made a change too.
Wout Weghorst is on for Donyell Malen. Weghorst is still a Burnley player.
How are the stress levels? This is going to be a tense 45 minutes or so. The stakes are so high.
Wout Weghorst has scored seven of his 12 goals for Netherlands as a substitute, including his winner against Poland in the group stage.
It's very stop-start in the early stages of the second half. There's more excitement in the stands than on the pitch. England fans have not stopped singing all match.
England are controlling the ball well. Luke Shaw is already trying to influence the game. The substitute tries to pick out Harry Kane with a cross but it's blocked.
Declan Rice escapes a yellow card after a clear foul. This is highly competitive but there has only been one booking so far to Denzel Dumfries.
A crucial stage of this semi-final. Both teams look scared to make a mistake. This isn't being played at anywhere near the same tempo as the first half. That can all change in a flash, of course.
Here come England through Jude Bellingham. A beautiful turn by Phil Foden but Harry Kane cannot keep possession.
We've reached the hour mark. Too early to start talking about extra-time?
What has happened to this game? It was action-packed, edge of your seat stuff in the first 45 minutes. Nothing like that this half.

Jordan Pickford to the rescue! A set-piece for the Dutch and it's curled into the England box and Virgil van Dijk times his run to perfection. The Netherlands captain makes a good connection and it's heading for the back of the net before Pickford flings himself to keep it out.
Wout Weghorst has made a couple of naughty challenges since coming on. Bukayo Saka and Phil Foden are not seeing the ball as much as they did in the first half.
The Dutch are whipping in cross after cross into the England box. Jordan Pickford has to stretch to put the latest one out for a corner. England have not been able to get going at all this half.
Twenty minutes from extra-time. Still just the one change by Gareth Southgate.
It's all a bit flat as far as England are concerned. They were exciting, entertaining and threatening in the first half. Nothing like that this half.
That's going to hurt! Jude Bellingham goes in VERY late on Stefan de Vrij and get a yellow card. Fair play to De Vrij for not making a big deal of that.
Nine yellow cards for England at Euro 2024. Jude Bellingham has two of them.
Outstanding by Kyle Walker! Cody Gakpo looked like he was about to burst clear before Walker comes across and times his challenge to perfection. He saved England there.
There's no zip about England. Still no new changes on the horizon.
Another good move by the Dutch and it ends with a snatched shot by Xavi Simons straight at Jordan Pickford. England are on the back-foot for now.
Double England change coming up. Cole Palmer and Ollie Watkins.
England have the ball in the back of the net! Bukayo Saka finishes off a great move from close range but the offside flag goes up straight away. It was tight...
This is it Cole Palmer and Ollie Watkins. It's your time to shine. Harry Kane has come off as has Phil Foden.
This is a big moment for Ollie Watkins. He has played only 20 minutes at this tournament but he now gets the chance to put his name up in lights.
A lightning break by the Netherlands. It looks like they have carved open England's defence and Wout Weghorst looks set to score until Marc Guehi saves the day with an incredible challenge.
Five minutes of normal time left. The Netherlands look the more likely to score.
Two quick bookings. Bukayo Saka and Virgil van Dijk see yellow following two separate incidents.
I get the feeling England will settle for extra time now.
Having said that... A great ball by Luke Shaw and Cole Palmer is lining up a shot...wide.

He's done itttttttttttttt! OLLIE WATKINS! Sensational scenes as the substitute surely wins it for England. He turns Stefan de Vrij in the box and produces the sweetest of finishes - low and hard. The Netherlands cannot believe it.
Talk about impact substitutions! Cole Palmer with the assist, Ollie Watkins with the finish. We're into three minutes of additional time at the end of the second half.
Has former Weston-super-Mare forward Ollie Watkins just fired England into the Euro 2024 final?
THEY'VE DONE IT! ENGLAND ARE INTO THE EUROPEAN CHAMPIONSHIP FINAL.
